document.masterDocTitle: A new synonym, a new male description and new geographical records for three Ceraeochrysa species (Neuroptera: Chrysopidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new synonym, a new male description and new geographical records for three Ceraeochrysa species (Neuroptera: Chrysopidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Chrysopa inexpectata
Alayo, 1968

, figs. 7 c, 15 a,
27 f.

Ceraeochrysa claveri (Navás)
:
Adams, 1982
: 72
;
Adams & Penny, 1985
: 444
, figs. 125–134 ;
Freitas & Penny, 2001
: 260
, fig. 11 ;
Penny, 2002
: 21
, figs. 171–176 .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Ceraeochrysa claveri
is often more yellow-green in coloration than others species of the genus. It is one of two members of the “
cincta
group” with black flagellum. It has only a dorsal dark-red line on the scape, distinguishing from
C. montoyana
, which has two lines, a lateral and a dorsal one. Other members of the “
cincta
group” may exhibit a dorsal line on the scape, but those may be distinguished from
C. claveri
by their pale flagellum.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 17–18.
Ceraeochrysa claveri
(Tarabana, Cabudare, Venezuela), head and thorax. 17) Dorsal view; 18) Lateral view. Note pale-yellow coloration and presence of a single dorsal line on scape.

FIGURES 19–29.
Ceraeochrysa claveri
. 19) Wings; 20–26) Male genitalia (Cabudare, Tarabana, Venezuela): 20) Tergite 9+ectoproct; 21) Gonarcus complex, dorsal view; 22) Gonarcus complex dorsocaudal view, note absence of trifurcated apex; 23) Gonarcus, dorsocaudal view showing small gonocornua; 24–25) Gonarcus complex, lateral view showing detail of lateral arm, gonarcus, gonocornu and entoprocessus. Fig. 25 showing digitiform process of gonarcus; 26) Gonapsis; 27–29) Female genitalia (Nirgua, Yaracuy, Venezuela): 27) Subgenitale; 28–29) ‘U’-shaped spermatheca, see coiled spermathecal duct and expanded on top of spermatheca. ar = arcessus; ap = apodeme; ent = entoprocessus; cc = callus cerci ; dp = digitiform process; gst = gonosetae; go = gonarcus; gco = gonocornu; la = lateral arm of gonarcus; sd = spermathecal duct; vbr = apodeme ventral branch.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks.
Freitas & Penny ( 2001 )
and
Freitas et al. ( 2009 )
made no reference to the presence of gonocornua and neither illustrated them.
Adams & Penny ( 1985 )
described and illustrated the gonocornua in detail for specimens of the Amazon basin. These structures were observed in all specimens herein studied.

Adams & Penny ( 1985 )
and
Penny ( 2002 )
referred to the presence of two lines in the
C. claveri
scape, but this characteristic was not observed in any specimens of the Venezuelan and Brazilian populations studied herein (see comparison with
C. montoyana
below).
